events.title: Anthony Joshua, boxer who defeated Jake Paul, survives deadly car crash
events.summary: British heavyweight and Olympic gold medalist Anthony Joshua survived a car crash in Nigeria that killed two other people, authorities said. Joshua escaped with minor injuries, according to police.

events.title: Bondi Beach terror attack suspects ‘acted alone,’ Australian police say
events.summary: Commissioner of the Australian Federal Police Krissy Barrett said during a news conference that the two alleged Bondi attackers “acted alone” and were "not part of a broader terrorist cell." Barrett went on to say that there had been speculation around the alleged shooters’ visit to the Philippines, but said there was “no evidence” to suggest they were directed by other to carry out the attack.

events.title: Passengers stuck after Australian cruise ship runs aground off coast of Papua New Guinea
events.summary: An Australian cruise ship with more than 120 people got stuck on a reef in Papua New Guinea. NBC News' Daniele Hamamdjian reports on the rescue efforts and how this is not the first incident the company has faced in recent months.

events.title: What to know about Elon Musk and China with Tesla's massive 'Gigafactory' in Shanghai
events.summary: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk’s relationship with party leaders in China is in the spotlight as the trade war ramps up. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on what this means for his popularity in the country.

events.title: At Gaza's only animal shelter, workers share what food they have with hungry dogs and cats
events.summary: A humble shelter operating out of a tent remains the last beacon of hope for the injured and hungry animal population in war-ravaged Gaza, even as its workers and volunteers face their own impossible conditions.“You cannot look at a creature that trusts you and eat in front of it without sharing,” Saeed Al-Aar, who founded the Sulala Animal Rescue shelter in 2006, told NBC News last month

events.title: A murder, a manhunt and the grandmother who wouldn't stop the search for her daughter's killer
events.summary: Josephine Wentzel spent years tracking down the suspect in her daughter’s death and is now helping others grieving cold cases.

events.title: Trump wants to bring Japan's 'cute' tiny cars to America — but it may not be easy
events.summary: It's all the truck he needs — one that picks up a new mattress from the furniture store, takes him to work and has ample space for groceries.“Most people have way more truck than they will ever use,” said David McChristian, 37, a firefighter from Houston.

events.title: How a child bride escaped Afghanistan and became a bodybuilding champion
events.summary: She left Afghanistan as a teenage mother. Now bodybuuilding champion Roya Karimi has a message for the Taliban.

events.title: Trump warns Iran and Hamas after meeting with Netanyahu
events.summary: The bilateral meeting with the Israeli prime minister at Mar-a-Lago comes as Trump seeks to advance the Gaza ceasefire deal that he brokered.

events.title: Search for missing Malaysia Airlines flight resumes, reviving hope of answers after more than a decade
events.summary: The search for the wreckage of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 is set to resume Tuesday, more than a decade after the plane went missing with 239 people onboard in one of the world’s greatest aviation mysteries.

events.title: Protests erupt in Iran as prices surge and currency hits new low
events.summary: Iran is facing its largest demonstrations in years as people hit the streets of Tehran and other cities to protest the country's dismal economic situation

events.title: China fires a warning to the U.S. and simulates blockade of Taiwan
events.summary: China fired rockets, massed assault ships and flew bombers around Taiwan on Tuesday, simulating a military blockade in a warning to the United States against supporting the Beijing-claimed island.

events.title: Boxer Anthony Joshua injured in car crash that killed 2 in Nigeria
events.summary: British heavyweight and Olympic gold medalist Anthony Joshua was in a speeding Lexus and survived a crash Monday morning in Nigeria that killed two other people, authorities said

events.title: Russia threatens Ukraine after alleged attack on Putin's residence
events.summary: Russia on Monday promised to retaliate against Ukraine after it said nearly 100 drones had targeted one of President Vladimir Putin's residences, likely throwing a wrench into President Donald Trump’s efforts to end the nearly four-year war."Such reckless actions will not go unanswered.

events.title: As Trump and Zelenskyy meet in Florida, Kyiv hopes this time will be different
events.summary: President Donald Trump and his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy return to the negotiating room on Sunday with a familiar, fraught task: trying to chart a path toward ending Russia’s war against Ukraine.

events.title: Brigitte Bardot, French actor and animal rights activist, dies at 91
events.summary: Screen siren Brigitte Bardot, whose portrayals of free-spirited ingenues made her an international sex symbol and the pride of France, and who turned her back on movie stardom in 1973 to become an animal rights activist, has died, according to French media and The Associated Press

events.title: Security guarantees remain critical issue ahead of Zelenskyy's meeting with Trump
events.summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is en route to the U.S. via Canada ahead of a weekend of high-stakes diplomacy and a renewed push for peace amid deadly Russian bombing on Ukraine’s capital

events.title: Trump and Zelenskyy to meet Sunday in Florida
events.summary: As Ukraine expressed willingness to withdraw troops from some occupied regions, Russia gave no indication it was ready to pull back from territory it has seized.

events.title: Europe pushes back at Trump's 'authoritarian' sanctions on anti-disinformation figures
events.summary: The State Department sanctioned Thierry Breton, Imran Ahmed, Clare Melford, Anna-Lena von Hodenberg and Josephine Ballon for "egregious acts" of censorship.

events.title: U.S. says it struck ISIS in Nigeria after Trump warns of attacks on Christians
events.summary: President Donald Trump on Thursday said he ordered “numerous” strikes on Islamic State terrorists in Nigeria he accused of killing Christians.“The United States launched a powerful and deadly strike against ISIS Terrorist Scum in Northwest Nigeria, who have been targeting and viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians, at levels not seen for many years, and even Centuries!” Trump said in a post on Truth Social

events.title: Top-end iPhones on sale in Gaza as food and medicine trickle into territory
events.summary: On the side of a dusty road in Gaza, dozens of mostly young men gather against the counter of a makeshift storefront.

events.title: 'It'll never be the same': Bondi Beach attack shatters life for Australia's Jewish residents
events.summary: SYDNEY — The sense of anger is palpable among members of the Jewish community in and around Bondi Beach as it reels from the attack on a Hanukkah celebration that killed 15 people

events.title: In Gaza, a humble Christmas celebration marks hope for an end to suffering
events.summary: It’s been two years since Jehan Trazi last celebrated Christmas
